messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `routes/admin.php`, I found that `CommentController::class` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/comments`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `routes/admin.php`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `CommentController::class`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Here are the files that contain a CommentController class implementation in this project:

- app/Http/Controllers/Admin/CommentController.php
- app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/CommentController.php
- app/Http/Controllers/CommentController.php

Explanation:
- The routes/admin.php file imports App\Http\Controllers\Admin\CommentController and wires several admin routes under /comments to that controller. Therefore, the actual handler implementations for the admin /comments endpoints live in app/Http/Controllers/Admin/CommentController.php.
- The other two files define a CommentController class in different namespaces (Api/V1 and root namespace). They represent separate controllers that may be used by other routes (e.g., API V1 or non-admin UI). They are separate implementations sharing the same class name but within different namespaces, so they are not used by the admin routes unless those routes point to those namespaces.
- For generating the OpenAPI spec focused on the admin /comments endpoints, you should inspect app/Http/Controllers/Admin/CommentController.php to extract the handler methods (index, edit, update, destroy) and their request/response details. The other two files are relevant if you also plan to document the API or routes that reference those namespaces.
